intro: Chaetadelpha, commonly known as the silky pea or silky bean, is a genus of flowering plants in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, often hairy leaves. The flowers are typically white or pale pink, with a distinctive, curled shape. The pods are long and slender, containing several seeds that are edible when young. Chaetadelpha species are native to Australia and are often found in dry, rocky habitats.
